column2: RI DMV PRACTICE TEST

1. If weather requires you to have your lights on, you should use your:
2. When you are involved in an accident and your vehicle is blocking traffic, you should:
column4: wait for the police to arrive before moving your vehicle.
column6: move your vehicle off of the travelled portion of the roadway, if possible.
column8: not move your vehicle under any circumstances.

column2: 3. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.
column6: watch for this species crossing the road.
column10: be ready to hit a reindeer.

column2: 4. To avoid hydroplaning, drivers should:
5. When driving in work zones you should:
column6: gradually come to a complete stop and wait for a flagger to guide traffic safely through the work zone.
column8: carefully watch for workers and moving equipment.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
7. This road sign means:
8. When approaching a blind person walking with a white cane or guide dog, drivers should yield the right-of-way.
9. What does a red arrow on a traffic light mean?
column4: You may proceed slowly through the intersection.
column6: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
column8: You must stop. Do not go in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.
column10: You may turn in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 10. Before stopping your vehicle on the roadway, drivers should:
column6: pump the brakes to check if they work properly.
column8: place their foot on the accelerator.

column2: 11. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column8: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column10: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.

column2: 12. At an intersection without stop or yield signs, you should:
column4: wait until there are no vehicles at the intersection.
column6: yield to the vehicle to your right.
column8: yield to the vehicle to your left.

column2: 13. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column4: Immediately come to a complete stop
column8: Proceed with caution through the intersection
column10: Slow down and be prepared to stop

column2: 14. Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
column6: if you have the green light.
column8: on the opposite side of the street.

column2: 15. When in a vehicle, wear a seat belt:
16. You may not pass another vehicle on either side of a _______ centerline.
17. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
18. When parking uphill on a road with a curb, turn the front wheels:
19. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
column8: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 20. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
21. A flashing red light means:
column4: The light will soon change to steady red.
column6: The same as a STOP sign.
column10: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 22. When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
column4: checking the rearview and outside mirrors.
column8: turning your head and glancing over your shoulder.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
24. Drivers may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if:
column4: the yellow line next to their side of the road is broken.
column6: the vehicle ahead moves to the right to let them pass.
column8: the yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.

column2: 25. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column10: The driver who does not control the car.
